page.title: 02MEMORIES OF SKELTON
page.content: Skelton today is a large, expanding town. In 1920 it was a small village surrounded by green fields and farm land. It consisted of small cottages and three rows of housing for the iron stone miners. Since the war three council estates have been built and many private developments. Everybody knew each other in pre-war Skelton. Today the population is too big. A local event in Skelton used to be the Monkey Parade. Teenagers from all around would come to walk up and down the High Street with the boys chatting up the girls. It used to be a romantic place on a Sunday. Today Skelton has changed completely and many new people have come into the area. The old way of life and community spirit of long ago has gone.Horse drawn vehicles have given way to modern transport and new way of life.(Mrs.Eileen Lowe b.1913)
